RoomGenerator

Class HouseBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • RoomGenerator.HouseBuilder

  • public class HouseBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    RoomGenerator class for the main application. Creates a procedurally generated map consisting of tiles stored in a 2D array of Tiles. The map is completely space filled. Given a width and height, HouseBuilder builds a map with these dimensions of a large room. At each tile, a zombie has a chance to spawn there. Then, HouseBuilder partitions the map into 4 quadrants. In these four quadrants we are left with 4 large chunks of rooms. Per quadrant, we start placing hallways (and doors for these hallways), splitting each quadrant up into hallways and rooms randomly. Once done, we add the player spawn point in a randomly selected quadrant and add the end point in the quadrant counter clockwise to the player spawn. Then, from the player spawn, we make doorways from quadrant to quadrant going clockwise. Thus, a player must traverse through each quadrant to reach the end point.

        Returns:

      • connectQuadrants

        private void connectQuadrants(int quadrant)
        Recursive method to connect all 4 quadrants together. Given a quadrant, makes a door to the quadrant directly counter clockwise to that quadrant. If the given quadrant is the quadrant with the end point, stop. We don't want to make a door directly from the player quadrant to the final quadrant.
        Parameters:
        quadrant - the quadrant

      • partitionQuadrant

        private void partitionQuadrant(int quadrant)
        Given a quadrant chunk, a large room, split it up into multiple hallways and rooms
        Parameters:
        quadrant - the quadrant

      • addDoorsToHall

        private void addDoorsToHall(int hallStartPoint,
                            boolean isVertical,
                            RoomCluster c)
        Adds two doorways on a hallway, one on each long side.
        Parameters:
        hallStartPoint - the hall start point, the top left most pathable tile in the quadrant
        isVertical - Denotes if the hallway is vertical or horizontal
        c - The room cluster we are currently working inside of

      • addObstacles

        private void addObstacles()
        Randomly chooses points on the map. If the map is a room tile, check to see if there are any obstacles within 2 tiles of that point. If there is nothing, add an obstacle to that tile.

      • makeHall

        private void makeHall(RoomCluster c,
                      boolean isVertical)
        Given a cluster and a type of hallway(vertical or horizontal), if the cluster is large enough, the method splits the cluster with the type of hallway in a valid position.
        Parameters:
        c - The room cluster we are currently adding a hallway to
        isVertical - Denotes if the hallway to add will be verticla or horizontal

      • markQuadrants

        private void markQuadrants()
        Marks the perimeter and split the four quadrants to four equal large rooms

      • makeEndPoint

        private void makeEndPoint(int endQuadrant)
        Given a quadrant, it finds two adjacent points on an outer wall that is not obstructed by any walls in front of it and denotes it as the end point
        Parameters:
        endQuadrant - The quadrant to place the endpoint inside of

      • findQuadrantStartPoint

        private java.awt.Point findQuadrantStartPoint(int quadrant)
        Given a quadrant, returns the point to the top-left corner tile, the starting tile.
        Parameters:
        quadrant - The quadrant we are trying to find the top-left corner tile for.
        Returns:
        The start point, the location of the top left most corner tile in the quadrant.

      • makePlayerSpawnPoint

        private int makePlayerSpawnPoint()
        Randomly chooses 1 of the 4 quadrants, and denotes a spawn in any point in a hallway. Returns the quadrant the player spawned in and sets playerSpawnPoint to the appropriate point.
        Returns:
        An integer denoting what quadrant the method chose.

      • cleanMap

        private void cleanMap()
        Initializes every tile in house[][] as a room tile, and decides if a zombie will spawn there.

      • printMap

        private void printMap()
        For debugging and testing purposes, prints the map by each char tileType
